contentrichtext.text: {{pp-vandalism|expiry=27 July 2013|small=yes}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | Name = Oxide & Neutrino | Img = | Img_capt = | Background = group_or_band | Origin = [[London]], [[United Kingdom]] | Genre = [[UK garage]] | Years_active = 1999–2007, 2011–present | Label = [[East West Records]] | Associated_acts = [[So Solid Crew]] | URL = [http://www.myspace.com/oxideneutrino MySpace] | Current_members = Alex Rivers<br/>Mark Oseitutu }} '''Oxide & Neutrino''' are a British [[Disc jockey|DJ]] and [[Master of ceremonies|MC]] [[UK garage|garage]] duo from [[London]], consisting of Alex Rivers (b. 1982, [[Isleworth]], London) and Mark Osei-Tutu (b. 1982, [[Brixton]], London). ==Musical career== Their first single "[[Bound 4 Da Reload (Casualty)]]" went to number 1 in the [[United Kingdom]] in May 2000.<ref name="British Hit Singles & Albums">{{cite book| first= David| last= Roberts| year= 2006 | title= British Hit Singles & Albums| edition= 19th| publisher= Guinness World Records Limited | location= London| isbn= 1-904994-10-5| page= 413}}</ref> It is known for [[sampling (music)|sampling]] the [[theme music]] to the [[BBC One]] hospital drama series ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'', and also contains samples of dialogue from the 1998 [[film]], ''[[Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels]]''. Their music appears in the film ''[[Ali G Indahouse]]'' in the form of the track "Shoot to Kill", which is played in the movie from car stereos. This track is also featured on the original [[soundtrack]] [[Compact disc|CD]]. Oxide & Neutrino are members of UK garage group, [[So Solid Crew]]. Oxide has also [[record producer|produced]] tracks on [[Lisa Maffia]]'s debut [[album]], ''First Lady'', and the track "Industry Lady" on Face's mixtape ''Sign 2 the Block''. In 2007, the duo made a return to the music scene, first with a new single "What R U" released on 14 May, and then with their fourth album ''2nd Chance'' following on 11 June. An interview with Darker Romello of Mayhem TV entitled "The Return of Oxide & Neutrino" appeared on ''Grimedaily'', announcing new material set to be released in the summer of 2011.<ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2MYqPzMqXk8</ref> ==Discography== ===Albums=== *2000: ''[[The Solid Sound of the Underground]]'' *2001: ''[[Execute (Oxide & Neutrino album)|Execute]]'' - [[UK Albums Chart|UK]] #11 U.K sales: 300,000+ BPI: Platinum *2002: ''[[2 Stepz Ahead]]'' - UK #28 *2007: ''[[2nd Chance (Oxide & Neutrino album)|2nd Chance]]'' - 11 June 2007 <ref name="British Hit Singles & Albums"/> ===Singles=== '''From ''Execute'':''' * "[[Bound 4 Da Reload (Casualty)]]" - [[UK Singles Chart|UK]] #1 in May 2000 U.K sales: 200,000+ BPI: Sliver * "No Good 4 Me" (featuring [[Megaman (musician)|Megaman]], [[MC Romeo]] & [[Lisa Maffia]])- UK #6 in December 2000 U.K sales:200,000+ BPI:Sliver * "Up Middle Finger" - UK #7 in May 2001 * "Devil's Nightmare" - UK #16 in July 2001 '''From ''2 Stepz Ahead'':''' * "Rap Dis"/"Only Wanna Know U Cos Ure Famous" (Remix) - UK #12 in November 2001 * "Dem Girls (I Don't Know Why)" (featuring [[Kowdean]]) - UK #10 in October 2002 '''From ''2nd Chance'':''' * "What R U" - 14 May 2007 ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://oxideneutrino.blogspot.co.uk/ Oxide & Neutrino Official Site] * [http://www.myspace.com/oxideneutrino Oxide & Neutrino Official Myspace] {{DEFAULTSORT:Oxide and Neutrino}} [[Category:So Solid Crew members]] [[Category:English hip hop groups]] [[Category:English musical duos]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 2000]] [[Category:UK garage groups]]
